critique: This executive order terminates the Division of Central Administrative Services of the Office for Emergency Management and transfers its functions to other federal agencies. It appears to be an administrative action related to wartime management. There is no clear indication of ideological bias, immigration stance, or impact on civil liberties. The order delegates authority to the Director of the Bureau of the Budget for determining the disposition of the Division's functions, personnel, and assets. This suggests a neutral stance on most axes. However, the transfer of functions to other federal agencies could be seen as a slight increase in federal control, and the termination of an office related to emergency management could be interpreted as a slight decrease in executive power, although it is more likely a restructuring due to changing wartime needs.
